questions.question: A Perceptron can solve
options: All
The NAND function
The XOR function
The OR/AND function
questions.answer: The OR/AND function
questions.explanation: Un perceptron résout uniquement les fonctions linéairement séparables (comme AND/OR). XOR ne l’est pas, donc il ne peut pas le résoudre.

questions.question: Reinforcement learning is similar to...
options: Supervised learning
None Reinforcement learning is another paradigm
Unsupervised learning
Genetic algorithms
questions.answer: None Reinforcement learning is another paradigm
questions.explanation: Le RL est un paradigme distinct : l’agent apprend par essais/erreurs via des récompenses, pas à partir de paires (X, Y) étiquetées.

questions.question: What are the inputs of biological neurons?
options: The cell body
The Synapses
The axon
The Dendrites
questions.answer: The Dendrites
questions.explanation: Les dendrites reçoivent les signaux en entrée (via des synapses), puis ceux-ci sont intégrés au niveau du soma.

questions.question: What was the name of the AI able to beat the best GO player in 2015?
options: AlphaGo
AlphaGoZero
Deep Blue
Deep Net
questions.answer: AlphaGo
questions.explanation: En 2015, AlphaGo bat le pro Fan Hui (première victoire contre un joueur professionnel) puis Lee Sedol en 2016.

questions.question: What was the name of the AI able to beat Kasparov in 1997?
options: Deep Blue
AlphaGo
AlphaGo Zero
Deep Net
questions.answer: Deep Blue
questions.explanation: Deep Blue d’IBM a battu Garry Kasparov en match officiel en 1997 aux échecs.

questions.question: In reinforcement learning the environment takes as input the action performed by the agent and returns
options: A new state
The next action to perform and a new state
Nothing
A new state and a reward
questions.answer: A new state and a reward
questions.explanation: Après une action, l’environnement renvoie l’état suivant et un signal de récompense pour guider l’apprentissage.

questions.question: Why did Microsoft's AI chatbot become racist?
options: Because the bot started following racist persons on Twitter
Because the bot figured out it was an interesting solution to minimize the given cost function
Because the bot created a biased representation of the world
Because people started tweeting the bot with all sort of misogynistic, racist remarks
questions.answer: Because people started tweeting the bot with all sort of misogynistic, racist remarks
questions.explanation: Tay apprenait en temps réel à partir des tweets; des utilisateurs lui ont massivement envoyé des messages toxiques qu’elle a mimés.

questions.question: A Multilayer Perceptron can solve
options: The XOR function
All
The OR/AND function
The NAND function
questions.answer: All
questions.explanation: Les MLP (couches cachées non linéaires) sont des approximants universels et peuvent modéliser XOR, AND/OR, etc.

questions.question: Deep learning is good working with...
options: A lot of noisy training data
Neural Network
Small and noisy data
Accurate training data
questions.answer: A lot of noisy training data
questions.explanation: Les réseaux profonds tirent parti de très grands volumes de données (même bruitées) pour apprendre des représentations robustes.

questions.question: How does AlphaGo work?
options: The algorithm relies on Deep neural networks and supervised learning
The algorithm relies on evolutionary algorithms
The algorithm relies in Deep neural network, Supervised learning and Unsupervised learning
The algorithm relies on Deep neural networks, Supervised Learning and reinforcement learning
questions.answer: The algorithm relies on Deep neural networks, Supervised Learning and reinforcement learning
questions.explanation: AlphaGo combine des réseaux profonds (politique/valeur), un pré-entraînement supervisé et un affinement par RL + Monte Carlo Tree Search.

questions.question: What is the Validation set in Machine learning?
options: It is used for finally checking the overall performance of a neural net
It is used to determine the performance of a neural network on patterns that are not trained during learning
It is used to train a neural net. The error of this dataset is minimizing during training
It is used to train, validate and test the model
questions.answer: It is used to determine the performance of a neural network on patterns that are not trained during learning
questions.explanation: Le jeu de validation n’est pas utilisé pour mettre à jour les poids; il sert à régler les hyperparamètres et surveiller l’overfitting (distinct du test final).

questions.question: What are the 'outputs' of biological neurons?
options: The Dendrites
The cell body
The Synapses
The axon
questions.answer: The axon
questions.explanation: L’axone conduit le potentiel d’action vers les terminaisons axonales qui communiquent avec d’autres neurones via des synapses.

questions.question: What is Deep Learning?
options: Deep learning is a subset of machine learning in AI that has networks capable of learning unsupervised form data that is unstructured or unlabeled
Deep learning is a biological simulation of the human brain
Deep learning is a subset of generic algorithms in the AI that has networks capable of learning unsupervised from data that is unstructured or unlabeled
Deep learning is an extension of symbolic AI that has networks capable of learning unsupervised from data that is unstructured and unlabeled
questions.answer: Deep learning is a subset of machine learning in AI that has networks capable of learning unsupervised form data that is unstructured or unlabeled
questions.explanation: Le deep learning s’appuie sur des réseaux multi-couches apprenant des représentations; il peut aussi apprendre sans labels (auto-encodeurs, etc.).

questions.question: What is the Training set in Machine Learning?
options: It is used for finally checking the overall performance of a neural net
It is used to train, validate and test the model
It is used to determine the performance of a neural network on patterns that are not trained during learning
It is used to train a neural net. The error of this dataset is minimized during training
questions.answer: It is used to train a neural net. The error of this dataset is minimized during training
questions.explanation: Le jeu d’entraînement sert à ajuster les poids en minimisant la fonction de coût.

questions.question: Why is Imagenet so hard to learn for a model?
options: Because of the millions of classes and the high number of images
Because of the non-linearity in the distribution of images
Because of the millions of images and the high number of classes
Because of the size of the dataset
questions.answer: Because of the millions of images and the high number of classes
questions.explanation: ImageNet contient un très grand volume d’images (~millions) et un grand nombre de classes (1 000), ce qui rend la tâche difficile.

questions.question: Why is it required to minimize an error to train a deep learning model?
options: Because we want the model to be able to predict a minimized version of the error at the end
Because we want the model to be able to predict the best output. The error measures the cost of the model
Because we want to use a gradient descent
Because we want the model to be able to predict the best output. The error measures the accuracy with respect to the training set
questions.answer: Because we want the model to be able to predict the best output. The error measures the cost of the model
questions.explanation: La fonction d’erreur/cout quantifie l’écart aux cibles; la minimiser oriente l’optimisation vers des prédictions plus justes.

questions.question: What is the Turing test?
options: The Turing test tries to evaluate the intelligence of an AI system
The Turing test is a test to see if a computer can trick a person into believing that a computer is a person too
The Turing test is a test to see if a computer can think
The Turing test is a test to evaluate the capability of computer to interact with someone
questions.answer: The Turing test is a test to see if a computer can trick a person into believing that a computer is a person too
questions.explanation: Dans le test de Turing, si un humain ne peut pas distinguer la machine d’un humain en conversation, la machine ‘réussit’ le test.

questions.question: What is the Bias Problem in Machine Learning?
options: The problem of being stuck into sub optimal solution
The problem of not learning meaningful correlations
The incapability for a neutral network to generalize without bias
The problem of learning and repeating human bias into an algorithm
questions.answer: The problem of learning and repeating human bias into an algorithm
questions.explanation: Des données biaisées conduisent les modèles à reproduire (voire amplifier) ces biais dans leurs prédictions.

questions.question: In order to train a model with supervised learning to predict something you first need to
options: Get an appropriate dataset
Setup an environment
Setup a reward, then maximize this reward
Setup an error, then minimize this error
questions.answer: Get an appropriate dataset
questions.explanation: Sans jeu de données adapté et étiqueté, l’apprentissage supervisé n’est pas possible.

questions.question: When was the last major breakthrough in Deep Learning and why?
options: 2006, because of the low error on the Imagenet Dataset
2012, because of the low error on the Imagenet Dataset
2012, because of the low error on MNIST
2006, because of the low error on MNIST
questions.answer: 2012, because of the low error on the Imagenet Dataset
questions.explanation: AlexNet (2012) a fait chuter l’erreur sur ImageNet, déclenchant l’ère moderne du deep learning.

questions.question: Supervised learning...
options: Takes S (state) and output R (reward)
Takes S (state) and output A an action to take
Takes X (inputs), T (targets) as input and output Y (the prediction)
Takes X (inputs) and output X' (a transformed representation of X)
questions.answer: Takes X (inputs), T (targets) as input and output Y (the prediction)
questions.explanation: On apprend une fonction f: X → Y à partir d’exemples étiquetés (X, T).

questions.question: Select the correct proposal
options: Deep learning is a subfield of Machine Learning which is a Subfield of AI
Machine Learning is the same thing as Deep learning which is a subfield of AI
Machine Learning is a subfield of Deep Learning which is a subfield of AI
Machine learning is a subfield of Symbolic AI which is a subfield of AI
questions.answer: Deep learning is a subfield of Machine Learning which is a Subfield of AI
questions.explanation: Hiérarchie correcte : AI ⊃ Machine Learning ⊃ Deep Learning.

questions.question: Unsupervised learning...
options: Takes S (state) and output R (reward)
Takes S (state) and output A an action to take
Takes X (inputs), T (targets) as input and output Y (the prediction)
Takes X (inputs) and output X' (a transformed representation of X)
questions.answer: Takes X (inputs) and output X' (a transformed representation of X)
questions.explanation: Sans labels, on apprend des représentations/structures latentes (clustering, réduction de dimension, auto-encodeurs).

questions.question: In what does AlphaGoZero differ from AlphaGo?
options: AlphaZero does not learn from human (dataset) but by total self-play
AlphaGoZero does not learn with supervised learning but with unsupervised leaning
AlphaGoZero does not learn from human (dataset) but by total self-play
AlphaGoZero does not learn from evolutionary algorithms but with genetic algorithms
questions.answer: AlphaGoZero does not learn from human (dataset) but by total self-play
questions.explanation: AlphaGo Zero apprend uniquement par auto-jeu (self-play) + RL, sans données humaines.

questions.question: Narrow AI is...
options: An intelligent system limited by computational capabilities
An AI able to perform only one task
An AI limited in order not to take over Humans
An AI able to perform one set of task from the same distribution
questions.answer: An AI able to perform one set of task from the same distribution
questions.explanation: Il s’agit d’une IA spécialisée sur un domaine étroit (ensemble de tâches homogènes), par opposition à l’AGI.

questions.question: What is Artificial General Intelligence?
options: Machines able to perform a wide variety of human tasks
Any intellect that greatly exceeds the cognitive performance of humans in virtually all domains of interest
Machines that exhibit human intelligence
An AI able to used previous knowledge to solve new problems
questions.answer: Machines able to perform a wide variety of human tasks
questions.explanation: AGI = capacité de niveau humain générale, transférable à de nombreuses tâches variées.

questions.question: What is the name of a famous algorithm to minimize a function/error in a neural network?
options: Partial differentiation
Gradient Descent
Regression
Optimistic search
questions.answer: Gradient Descent
questions.explanation: La descente de gradient met à jour les paramètres dans la direction opposée au gradient pour réduire le coût.

questions.question: What is epsilon-greedy?
options: A popular reinforcement learning algorithm
A method to estimate the best possible action to perform
This is an exploration method. 'Epsilon' is the percentage of exploration, 'greedy' the percentage of exploitation
This is an exploration method. 'Epsilon' is the percentage of exploitation, 'greedy' the percentage of exploration
questions.answer: This is an exploration method. 'Epsilon' is the percentage of exploration, 'greedy' the percentage of exploitation
questions.explanation: Avec probabilité ε on explore aléatoirement; sinon on choisit l’action la plus rentable connue (exploitation).

questions.question: What is an overfitting?
options: A model that models the 'validation set' too well
A model that models the 'training data' badly
A model that models the 'training data' too well
A model that models the 'testing set' badly
questions.answer: A model that models the 'training data' too well
questions.explanation: Le modèle s’adapte trop aux spécificités du train (bruit), et généralise mal aux données nouvelles.

questions.question: What is Artificial Super Intelligence?
options: An AI able to use previous knowledge to solve new problems
Machines able to perform all human tasks
Any intellect that greatly exceeds the cognitive performance of humans in virtually all domains of interest
Machines that exhibit human intelligence
questions.answer: Any intellect that greatly exceeds the cognitive performance of humans in virtually all domains of interest
questions.explanation: ASI désigne une intelligence dépassant largement les capacités humaines dans quasiment tous les domaines.
